org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.recovery
Class AeRecoveryQueueManager

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeManagerAdapter
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeBaseQueueManager
          org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.recovery.AeRecoveryQueueManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeManager, IAeQueueManager, IAeRecoveryQueueManager
public class AeRecoveryQueueManager
extends AeBaseQueueManager
implements IAeRecoveryQueueManager

Implements a queue manager for recovery. Extends AeBaseQueueManager to leverage its functionality for matching inbound receives to message receivers.

                      IAeInvokeInternal aInvokeQueueObject)
               throws AeBusinessProcessException
Description copied from interface: IAeQueueManager
The invoke queue object contains all of the necessary information to perform an invocation on a target endpoint. The actual invoke operation is handled at a different layer asynchronously.

addMessageReceiver

public void addMessageReceiver(AeMessageReceiver aMessageReceiver)
                        throws AeBusinessProcessException
Description copied from interface: IAeQueueManager
Queues a message receiver. This message receiver (e.g. receive, onMessage) will stay queued until a message arrives for it from the outside world or until it is explicity dequeued by the process.

Specified by:

addNonDurableReply

public void addNonDurableReply(AeReply aReply,
                               AeMessageReceiver aMessageReceiver)
                        throws AeConflictingRequestException
Description copied from interface: IAeQueueManager
Queues a reply object. Once queued the reply must be dequeued in order for a process to complete successfully. If a reply is a durable reply, then the implementation ignores the reply (i.e. short return) since durable replies are maintained and handled by the IAeBusinessProcess.

Specified by:
addNonDurableReply in interface IAeQueueManager
Overrides:
addNonDurableReply in class AeBaseQueueManager
Throws:
AeConflictingRequestException
See Also:
IAeQueueManager.addNonDurableReply(org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.queue.AeReply, org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.queue.AeMessageReceiver)

removeAlarm

public boolean removeAlarm(long aProcessId,
                           int aLocationId,
                           int aAlarmId)
                    throws AeBusinessProcessException
Description copied from interface: IAeQueueManager
Removes an alarm. The removal of an alarm requires it to be unscheduled (cancelled) in addition to whatever other bookkeeping must be done by the alarm manager implementation. Note that removeAlarm will be called by the engine when an alarm should be cancelled (not fired) as well as when the alarm was fired and must now be removed from whatever internal storage the alarm manager implementation is using.

Specified by:
removeAlarm in interface IAeQueueManager
Overrides:
removeAlarm in class AeBaseQueueManager
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
See Also:
IAeQueueManager.removeAlarm(long, int, int)

removeAlarmForDispatch

public long removeAlarmForDispatch(long aProcessId,
                                   int aGroupId,
                                   int aLocationId,
                                   int aAlarmId)
                            throws AeBusinessProcessException
Description copied from interface: IAeQueueManager
Removes an alarm for purposes of dispatching it to a process. The alarm will be removed from storage and added to the process journal. The journal id will be returned. If the NULL journal id is returned, then the alarm was NOT deleted, and therefore should not be dispatched to the process.

Specified by:
removeAlarmForDispatch in interface IAeQueueManager
Overrides:
removeAlarmForDispatch in class AeBaseQueueManager
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
See Also:
IAeQueueManager.removeAlarmForDispatch(long, int, int, int)
